entry.title: Re: Batch Inbound Integration - Use of element ChangeOrdi...
entry.content:
Hello @robert_siebert 

Your understanding of the ChangeOrdinalNumberValue element is accurate. This value plays a crucial role in the Batch Inbound Integration SOAP API, acting as a version control to ensure data integrity and prevent updates from being overlooked or processed in the wrong order.

Reasons to Avoid Using a Timestamp

Using a timestamp is unreliable because of potential issues with clock synchronisation and the risk of concurrent updates generating identical timestamps. The ChangeOrdinalNumberValue is a SAP-generated value that guarantees a strict sequential order.

The Best Practice

The most reliable and recommended approach is for your third-party WMS to store the ChangeOrdinalNumberValue from SAP's response.

Initial Creation: When the WMS creates a new batch in SAP, it must record and store the ChangeOrdinalNumberValue returned in SAP's successful response.

For all future updates to the same batch, the WMS must include the most recent ChangeOrdinalNumberValue in its request to SAP.

This guarantees that each update is applied to the correct version of the batch record, avoiding data inconsistencies and complying with the API's design for dependable integration.

SAP Useful References

SAP API Business Hub: The official documentation for the Batch Inbound Integration API explains the payload structure and the purpose of the ChangeOrdinalNumberValue field. You can find this documentation at Business Accelerator Hub

SAP Help Portal: The SAP Help Portal's documentation on batch management and integration offers a broader overview of managing master data updates. You can access this documentation at Batch - Inbound Integration.

This video provides an introduction to SAP Business Hub, an essential tool for exploring and testing SAP APIs. How to Search for SAP Standard API - Introduction to SAP Business Hub

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Issue with Capacity Category 001 in Scope Item 31L
entry.content:
Hello @sergio21 

Thank you for your question. Please note that in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Starter System, your observed behaviour is expected.

  • Capacity Category 001 (Machine) and its associated values such as start time, end time, break length, utilization, etc. are delivered as preconfigured reference content and are locked in the starter system. These entries cannot be modified because the Starter System is meant for exploration and demo purposes, not for customizing the underlying standard configuration.
  • The error message you received reflects the restriction in the Starter System.

In your Quality or Productive system, you can configure work center capacities through SSCUI 102402 Define Work Center Capacity or via the Manage Work Center Capacity app. Doing this will allow you to maintain shift intervals, capacity utilization, and individual capacity values as per your business requirement.

To summarize, Starter System restriction’s values are locked and cannot be edited. Quality/Production system configuration is open via SSCUIs and apps. You will be able to maintain and adapt the capacity categories, intervals and standard available capacities.

For more details refer to the following link.

Manage Work Center Capacity

I hope this provides the desired insights. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: EWM Public Cloud - Close Inbound Delivery with partia...
entry.content:
Hello @FernandoL 

Thank you for your question.

The error you mentioned occurs because the product is batch-managed and when doing a partial goods receipt you must always provide a batch number for the received quantity.

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, you cannot post partial receipts for batch-managed products without batch assignment.

Below are details on how you can proceed:

  1. Maintain Batch Information
    • In the Change Inbound Deliveries app, go to the relevant item.
    • Enter the batch number for the 300 PCs in the Batch field.
    • If multiple batches are received, split the item quantity into multiple line items and assign the corresponding batches.
  2. Post Partial Goods Receipt
    • Once batch is entered, use Post Goods Receipt from the inbound delivery.
    • The system will allow you to close the received part and leave the rest as open.
  3. Close or Open Items
    • If the supplier will not deliver the remaining 400 PCs, you must adjust the purchase order/ inbound delivery to reduce or close the outstanding quantity.
    • Use Change Inbound Deliveries → select the line item → choose Delete Remaining Quantity or update the PO accordingly.

Key Points to note: For batch managed products, every inbound delivery and goods receipt posting requires batch assignment. This also applies even for partial receipts.

Goods Receipt for Inbound Deliveries Batch-Managed Products

 I recommend you assign the batch number to the 300 PCs received, split the inbound delivery item if necessary, then post the partial goods receipt. Reduce or delete the open quantity if no further delivery is expected.

I hope this provides the desired insights. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Microsoft SharePoint Sender Adapter: itemNotFound Error While Accessing Files
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on a scenario in SAP CI where I need to download a file from SharePoint via the Microsoft SharePoint Adapter.

The file exists in the following location:

https://xxx.sharepoint.com/sites/ClaimsDocuments/SiteCollectionDocuments/Design/test.pdf
 
From Microsoft Graph API, I can confirm that the drive and file details are valid (using /sites/{site-id}/drives and /drives/{drive-id}/root:/Design/test.pdf:/content).

In Postman, the file download works fine.

But in CPI, when I configure the Sender adapter as:

  • Site Host Name: xxx.sharepoint.com

  • Server Relative Path: /sites/ClaimsDocuments

  • Directory: /SiteCollectionDocuments/Design

  • File Name: test.pdf

I always get the following error:

com.sap.adapters.factory.sharepoint.exception.SharePointException: {"error":{"code":"itemNotFound","message":"The resource could not be found."}}
 
My Questions:

  1. In CPI SharePoint Adapter, how do we correctly point to Site Collection Documents (especially since the name has spaces)?

  2. Do we need to use the drive ID instead of the library name when the document library name includes spaces?

  3. Has anyone successfully used CPI SharePoint Adapter to read/write files in SiteCollectionDocuments or similar libraries?

Thanks.

entry.title: Re: Multiple Delta Accrual on the Same Date
entry.content:
Hello @chirashamihwa 

Thank you for your question.

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, once you execute a delta accrual run for a specific key date (e.g., 30 June 2025), the system will not allow you to re-run another delta accrual on the same date. This is why your missed billing documents are not picked up.

To include those outstanding billing documents, you need to run the next delta accrual run with a later key date (e.g., 1 July 2025 or any date after).

To achieve this, consider resolving the following process:

First, check the missed billing documents

    • Verify they are released to accounting and meet the condition contract accrual criteria.
    • Ensure they carry the same validity period (01.01.2025 – 30.06.2025).

Thereafter, run the Delta Accrual with a later date

    • Use the Delta Accruals Condition Contract app.
    • Enter a key date after 30 June 2025 (e.g., 01.07.2025).
    • The system will pick up only those documents that were missed in the previous accrual run and post the delta amounts accordingly.
  1. Finally, you need to validate your entries. After posting, check the Accruals Monitor to ensure the additional billing documents are now included in the accrual balances.

Settlement Management

Condition Contract Management – Accruals

I hope this provides the desired insights. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Creating QR codes in B1 HANA
entry.content:
Here is an example:

CREATE PROCEDURE TmSp_QRCodeSPGenerated_XX_13 (in DocKey integer, in ObjectID integer)

LANGUAGE SQLSCRIPT

SQL SECURITY INVOKER

AS

BEGIN

SELECT Cast(T0."U_EInvGSignedQRCode" as NVARCHAR) as "QRCode" FROM OINV T0

WHERE T0."DocEntry" = :DocKey;

END;

entry.title: Re: How to improve the performance of prepared statements...
entry.content:
So you execute Connection.prepareStatement() for every query. With DYNAMIC_PREPARE on, it will check if the query is already precompiled in the db server. If yes, it just executes the already "prepared" query (passing the variable parameters of the current query)

This sounds like an extra server call for every query.  It's a quick call, but you're talking about sub-millisecond differences, so it's possible this is relevant.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ASE_SDK/c4016b5564ed4c98bbade36a3a35202d/b0eb3050bbf91014bbc3a199ff0441a8.html

entry.title: Re: Configure outbound Scenario from S/4 to CPI
entry.content:
Hello,

 

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

 

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) is helpful for you?

To run an outbound scenario from SAP S/4HANA Cloud to SAP Cloud Platform Integration (CPI), follow these steps:

1. Set Up Communication System

  • Create a Communication System: In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, navigate to the ‘Communication Systems’ app and create a new communication system. Provide a unique system name and configure the technical data, including host name and port.

 

2. Configure Communication Arrangement

  • Create a Communication Arrangement: Integrate SAP S/4HANA Cloud with third-party Warehouse Management System Go to the ‘Communication Arrangements’ app and create a new arrangement using the appropriate communication scenario. Select the communication system you created earlier.

 

3. Deploy Integration Flow in CPI

  • Deploy iFlow: Integrate SAP S/4HANA Cloud with SAP Cloud Platform Integration using SOAP Log in to SAP CPI and create an integration flow (iFlow) that will handle the message from S/4HANA Cloud. Configure the SOAP adapter and deploy the iFlow.

 

4. Monitor Message Processing

  • Monitor Messages: Use the ‘Message Processing Monitor’ in SAP CPI to track the messages sent from S/4HANA Cloud and ensure they are processed correctly.

 

5. Test the Integration

  • Test the Scenario: Create a test document in S/4HANA Cloud that triggers the outbound communication. Verify that the message is received and processed by the CPI.
[1] Integrate SAP S/4HANA Cloud with third-party Warehouse Management System
[2] Integrate SAP S/4HANA Cloud with SAP Cloud Platform Integration using SOAP

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: How to consume API's from business Accelerator hub in...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) is helpful for you?

To configure the destination and basic authentication for consuming an API from the SAP Business Accelerator Hub in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud system, follow these steps:

Step-by-Step Configuration

1. Create a Communication Arrangement Configuring Standard API in S/4 HANA Cloud

  • Communication Scenario: Use the scenario ID from the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  • Communication System: Create a new communication system in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud system.
  • Inbound Communication User: S/4HANA Cloud API Consumption 101 - Using Postman Set up a user with basic authentication.

2. Configure the Destination in SAP BTP

  • Destination Name: Choose a name for your destination.
  • Type: Set it to HTTP.
  • URL: Use the service URL from the communication arrangement.
  • Proxy Type: Set it to Internet.
  • Authentication: Choose BasicAuthentication.
  • User: Enter the username of the communication user.
  • Password: Enter the password of the communication user.

3. Implement the Service Consumption Model in ADT Integrating the ABAP Environment with SAP S/4HANA

  • EDMX File: Use the EDMX file from the SAP API Business Hub to create a service consumption model.
  • Class Implementation: In your ABAP class, use the service consumption model to call the API.

Troubleshooting

  • Ensure that the communication arrangement is correctly set up with the right scenario ID and user credentials.
  • Verify that the destination in SAP BTP is correctly configured with the URL and authentication details.

Additional Resources

  • SAP API Business Hub for API details.
  • SAP Help Portal for documentation on communication arrangements and destinations.

By following these steps, you should be able to configure the destination and authentication to consume the API successfully.

[1] Configuring Standard API in S/4 HANA Cloud
[2] S/4HANA Cloud API Consumption 101 - Using Postman
[3] Integrating the ABAP Environment with SAP S/4HANA

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: Application Job Template not working for Subcontracti...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) is helpful for you?

When you encounter a loading issue in the ‘Parameters’ section while scheduling a background job using the ‘Application Jobs’ app, it could be due to several reasons. Here are some steps you can take to resolve the issue:

  1. Check System Requirements: Ensure that your system meets all the necessary requirements for running the ‘Application Jobs’ app. Sometimes, missing configurations or updates can cause loading issues.

  2. Review Job Template Configuration: Manage Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Application Job Templates Verify that the job template you are using is correctly configured. You can do this by checking the job template settings in the ‘Application Job Templates’ app.

  3. Clear Cache and Cookies: Sometimes, browser cache and cookies can cause apps to malfunction. Try clearing your browser cache and cookies and then reload the app.

  4. Check Network Connectivity: Ensure that your network connection is stable. A poor connection can lead to loading issues.

  5. Consult SAP Support: If the issue persists, consider reaching out to SAP Support for assistance. They can provide more specific guidance based on your system configuration.

  6. Refer to Documentation: Check the SAP documentation for any known issues or troubleshooting steps related to the ‘Application Jobs’ app.

 

If you have tried these steps and the issue still persists, it might be a specific problem with the job template or your system configuration that requires further investigation by SAP support. Create Application Logs and attach it to Application Job in ABAP Cloud

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4 Hana public Expected Delivery Notification Al...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) is helpful for you?

To meet the requirement of notifying the requestor about the expected delivery date and sending a follow-up notification if no receipt is made, you can utilize the Situation Handling framework in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Here is a step-by-step guide to configure this:

Step 1: Configure Situation Handling

  1. Access the Manage Situation Types App: This app allows you to create and manage situation types.

  2. Create a Situation Type: Use the template ‘Approaching Delivery Date of Centrally Managed Purchase Requisitions’ Approaching Delivery Date of Centrally Managed Purchase Requisitions to notify about the delivery date. This template checks for centrally managed purchase requisition items whose delivery dates are approaching.

  3. Set Conditions: Define the conditions under which the notification should be sent. For example, set the number of days before the delivery date when the notification should be triggered.

  4. Define Recipients: Ensure that the notification is sent to the requestor. You can use responsibility rules or team assignments to determine the recipients.

Step 2: Configure Follow-up Notification

  1. Use the ‘Confirmation Overdue for PR Item’ Confirmation Overdue for PR Item Template: This template can be used to send a follow-up notification if the receipt of goods has not been confirmed after a certain period.

  2. Set Overdue Conditions: Configure the number of days after the scheduled delivery date when the follow-up notification should be triggered.

  3. Ensure Notification Settings: Verify that the notification settings are enabled for both the initial and follow-up notifications.

Troubleshooting

  • Check Situation Instances: Use the ‘Monitor Situations’ app to check if situation instances are being created.
  • Verify Recipient Configuration: Ensure that the recipients are correctly configured and registered as business partners.
  • Review Notification Settings: Confirm that email notifications are set up correctly and that the email domain is allowed.

By following these steps, you should be able to configure the notifications as required.

[1] Approaching Delivery Date of Centrally Managed Purchase Requisitions
[2] Confirmation Overdue for PR Item

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: How to Represent Supplier Discount as an Isolated Ite...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) is helpful for you?

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, representing a supplier discount as an isolated item with a negative price in a purchase order is not directly supported. However, there are alternative approaches to achieve the desired outcome of displaying the discount separately:

Alternative Approaches

  1. Use Condition Types for Discounts: 2951747 - How to print Price Conditions in the Purchase Order form

    • You can use condition types to represent discounts in the purchase order. This method allows you to apply discounts without affecting the material prices directly.
    • To ensure the discount is displayed separately, you can configure the output form to show the total discount amount at the end of the purchase order.

  2. Custom Form Templates:

    • Using Adobe LiveCycle Designer, you can create custom form templates that allow you to format the purchase order output according to your requirements.
    • This includes adding a separate line for the total discount amount at the end of the purchase order.

Steps to Implement

  • Create a Custom Form Template: 2863002 - Billing of batch split items Adapt the pre-delivered form template to include a separate section for discounts.
  • Configure Output Management: Ensure that the ‘Print Price’ indicator is set correctly to include the discount in the output form.

By following these steps, you can achieve a purchase order output that meets your customer’s requirements by displaying the discount separately without affecting the material prices.

[1] 2951747 - How to print Price Conditions in the Purchase Order form
[2] 2863002 - Billing of batch split items

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Retail, fashion and vertical business in SAP S/4HANA Cloud public edition 2508
entry.content:
Designed specifically for fashion and specialty businesses SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, retail, fashion, and vertical business natively support for enriched product management, advanced pricing, and promotional workflows—all integrated into core ERP processes.

It includes intuitive in-store apps that streamline procurement, inventory management, and omni-channel operations such as buy-online-pickup-in-store. Real-time data access helps store associates stay productive and customer-focused.

With comprehensive end-to-end process coverage, the solution ensures seamless operations across all roles and functions within a retail enterprise and covers key domains including master data, merchandising, supply chain, store operations, and sales. Modular scope items, documented in SAP’s Process Navigator, enable fast activation and reduced implementation complexity.

 

 The 2508 Release adds features across in-store sales, order management, and assortment operations, including hybrid orders, continuous scanning, support for weight-based articles, and mass assortment assignments. Here is a quick summary of some the key highlights in a short video:

 

 

Let’s dive into three key highlights that will help you deliver impact at scale.

Monetize Your Offerings: Charging for Value-Added Services (VAS)

Retail operations often involve additional services—like custom labelling or packaging—that carry extra costs. To manage these effectively, we’ve introduced a feature that allows users to define and assign Value-Added Service (VAS) charge codes directly at the item level in both Purchase Orders and Sales Orders.

These charge codes are centrally configured, making them easy to maintain and reusable across multiple service types. Once applied, they are automatically reflected in all relevant follow-on documents, ensuring consistency and transparency.

This capability supports accurate pricing by including service-related costs in the item’s total value. It also helps businesses offer tailored, premium services while maintaining clear visibility into associated charges—enhancing both operational efficiency and customer perception.


Mass assignment of products in assortments

For category managers and assortment specialists, keeping assortments up-to-date—especially during seasonal changes or new product introductions—can be a time-consuming and click-intensive process. We heard your feedback and have delivered a major enhancement to streamline this critical task.

The Manage Assortment Modules app now allows for the efficient mass assignment of products, transforming a manual effort into a smart, automated workflow.

Recent updates to assortment module management deliver significant improvements in both scale and precision.

You can now assign up to 1,000 products to an assortment module in a single batch—five times the previous limit of 200. This increase is achieved without any impact on system performance, allowing for larger and more efficient planning cycles.

To support more accurate product selection, we've introduced attribute-based filtering. Users can now filter by generic article, as well as specific characteristics like color and size, enabling precise and targeted assortment creation.

The user experience has also been streamlined. The assignment process now begins directly at the product selection list, reducing unnecessary navigation. Once products are assigned to a module, they are automatically removed from the selection list, helping prevent duplicate entries and simplifying tracking.

Together, these enhancements accelerate assortment planning, improve data accuracy, and allow retail teams to focus more on strategic, value-added activities.

These enhancements dramatically accelerate your assortment planning cycles, improve accuracy through attribute-based filtering, and free up your specialists’ time to focus on more strategic, value-added work.

 


Revolutionize In-Store Operations with Hybrid Sales Orders

Imagine a customer in your store. They want to purchase a camera that’s in stock and take it home today. At the same time, they want to pre-order a new coffee maker that is currently unavailable. Previously, this would require two separate, cumbersome transactions. Not anymore.

The 2508 release introduces hybrid sales order functionality in the Manage In-Store Sales Orders Fiori app, enabling store associates to process multiple fulfillment types within a single transaction.

This innovation addresses a common retail scenario: a customer wants to purchase an in-stock item for immediate pickup and simultaneously pre-order an unavailable product. Previously, this required two separate transactions. Now, both can be handled together.

Store associates can create one sales order that includes:

  • Immediate Pickup Items: Entered using standard item categories, with support for GTIN/barcode scanning to speed up product selection.
  • Scheduled Pickup Items: Designated with different item categories and shipping points to indicate future fulfillment.

The system intelligently separates fulfillment flows. When the associate selects “Generate Invoice,” only the immediate pickup items are processed. The system automatically creates the outbound delivery, posts goods issue, and generates the customer invoice. Items scheduled for later pickup remain open for future processing.

This enhancement simplifies operations, reduces transaction time, and allows associates to better serve customers with varied needs—all within a unified workflow.

 


### Stay Connected
These are just a few of the highlights from the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. We are dedicated to continuously enhancing our retail solution to meet the dynamic needs of your business.

To explore these features in more detail, please check out the resources below:

  • Official product page: SAP website | Partner portal (log in needed)
  • Full retail solution processes: Process Navigator – SAP for Me
  • Learning journey: Exploring SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, retail, fashion and vertical business
  • End-2-End Retail Demo: Interactive Value Journey

📽️ Watch the replays of our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Early Release Series! 

From July 21-25, we hosted a series of 21 compelling live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. Missed the live sessions? We've got you covered! Take advantage of the entire series or pick and choose the sessions most relevant to you. You will find the recording and presentation for LoB/Industry/Topic as well as 20 other topics of interest. Don't miss this chance and watch them on demand–anywhere, anytime. 

🔎Find all our assets 

We at Cloud ERP Product Success offer a service as versatile as our product itself. Check out the numerous offerings our team has created for you below:

entry.title: Re: Internal Error and Sales Order can not be saved in GE...
entry.content:
The error is caused A customer field YY1_123.

A custom field has been added and a refresh is required.

When you can add additional fields for example, afterwards, you need to refresh the structure Condition Parameters of Application in Output Parameter Determination in order to sync with the newly created fields. This is also outlined in the documentation below. 

4.3.3.3.2 Refresh Condition Parameters of Application

To resolve this issue, could you please execute steps below to refresh Condition Parameter of Application: 

  1. Log on to the SAP Fiori launchpad.
    2. Choose the Output Parameter Determination *
    3. Select Goods Movement from the Show Rules for dropdown list.
    4. Right-click next to the dropdown list. A context menu appears.
    5. Select the Refresh Condition Parameters of Application option from the context menu.
    6. Confirm the dialog box.
    7. The system notifies you about the success of the update.
    8. Select Output Type from the Determination Step dropdown list.
    9. Switch to edit mode by choosing Edit.
    10. Choose Table Settings to open the table settings dialog.
    11. Under Condition Columns, choose Insert Column.
    12. From the dropdown, choose From Context Data Objects.
    13. A dialog box appears, listing all available data objects for this decision table.
    14. Under Condition Parameters of Application, your newly added fields are displayed.

entry.title: Re: delete scheduled job in data migration
entry.content:
Hello @alisa_schlossberg-majer 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

In the Data Migration Cockpit, jobs created for migration projects are tracked both in the frontend (Fiori) and backend (technical job in ABAP system).

Based on the details your shared, your situation seems to be that old jobs are stuck in Scheduled status in Fiori, even though they were manually released and finished in the backend. You also cannot delete them from the Fiori app because the UI still thinks they are running.

To enable you delete those jobs, here is what i recommend doing:

Set the status to Error Resolved. This is the only option available in the Public Cloud system for jobs that are stuck. Once the status is set to Error Resolved, the system no longer considers them as active.

Then create a new Migration Project because SAP recommends creating a new migration project rather than trying to fix old ones that are stuck in Scheduled. This ensures clean handling of jobs in both backend and frontend.

Note that the Automatic Cleanup ensures that old migration jobs that remain in Scheduled will eventually be cleaned up automatically by the system (background housekeeping jobs). They do not block the creation of new projects or jobs.

Manage Migration Projects (Public Cloud)

I hope this provides the desired result. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Dynamic Template Download Upload Report on Year
entry.content:
Recantly , I was working on an requirement and sharing the same.

We need to develop a program to upload the Monthly Production plan. In input screen user will enter the year and execute we should get an excel template downloaded with columns Matnr , Plant and followed month of year. Upload function we will fill those details and upload will be saved to custom table and we need to give runtime save in alv(editable).

we will get year as input then we generate this template, and we will upload the same but there is twist we will upload data column-wise, but we need to update it row-wise here,

A010, B2, 1000, 2025, 01(Jan) this will one record in same way we will update all 12 records with respect to first row as A010, B2, 30, 2025, 12(Dec) in custom table.

Example:

PlantModel name25-Jan25-Feb25-Mar25-Apr25-May25-Jun25-Jul25-Aug25-Sep25-Oct25-Nov25-Dec
A010B21000400300500500300200500500604030
A010B32004003005005003002005005006040200
A010B45004003005005003002005005006040400
A010B53004003005005003002005005006040600

Difficult things to do in this task:

  • Generating the excel template on year (but we can do it easily). 
  • Handling uploaded data where in this requirement we need to update data row-wise in the system.
  • Selection Screen Design (Easy).

Simple Implementation: 

REPORT zztest_download_upload.

TABLES: sscrfields.
TYPE-POOLS: truxs.

TYPES: BEGIN OF tp_data,
         col1  TYPE string,
         col2  TYPE string,
         col3  TYPE string,
         col4  TYPE string,
         col5  TYPE string,
         col6  TYPE string,
         col7  TYPE string,
         col8  TYPE string,
         col9  TYPE string,
         col10 TYPE string,
         col11 TYPE string,
         col12 TYPE string,
         col13 TYPE string,
         col14 TYPE string,
       END OF tp_data.

TYPES: BEGIN OF tp_heading,
         heading(30),
       END OF tp_heading.

DATA: gt_data     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_data,
      gf_data     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_data,
      gv_data     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_data,
      gd_data     TYPE tp_data,
      gs_data     TYPE tp_data,
      gt_heading  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_heading,
      gs_heading  TYPE tp_heading,
      gt_fieldcat TYPE TABLE OF slis_fieldcat_alv,
      gs_fieldcat TYPE slis_fieldcat_alv,
      lv_date     TYPE string,
      lv_month    TYPE string,
      lv_year     TYPE string,
      lv_new_date TYPE string,
      lv_index    TYPE sy-tabix,
      lv_cell     TYPE string,
      index       TYPE I.
DATA : gs_prod_plan TYPE zzmm_m_prod_plan.

FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_cell>    TYPE string,
               <fs_input>   TYPE  tp_data,
               <fs_input_1> TYPE  tp_data,
               <fs_month>   TYPE tp_data,
               <fs_value>   TYPE any,
               <fs_value_1> TYPE any.
DATA : lv_field               TYPE char5,
       gv_model               TYPE mname,
       gv_plant               TYPE mcode,
       gv_filename            TYPE string,
       gv_path                TYPE string,
       gv_fullpath            TYPE string,
       gv_result              TYPE i,
       gv_template_downloaded TYPE abap_bool VALUE abap_false,
       it_raw                 TYPE truxs_t_text_data,
       gv_year                TYPE char4.

*INITIALIZATION.
*  gv_year = sy-datum+0(4).

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b1 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-001.
  PARAMETERS: rb_down RADIOBUTTON GROUP grp DEFAULT 'X' USER-COMMAND rb-s1,
              rb_up   RADIOBUTTON GROUP grp.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b1.

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b2 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-002.
  PARAMETERS: s_file TYPE rlgrap-filename MODIF ID sc2.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b2.

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b3 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-002.
  SELECT-OPTIONS: p_model  FOR gv_model MODIF ID sc1 .
  PARAMETERS: p_plant  TYPE mcode MODIF ID sc1 .
  PARAMETERS: p_year  TYPE t009b-bdatj OBLIGATORY.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b3.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN OUTPUT.
  IF rb_down = 'X'.
    LOOP AT SCREEN.
      IF screen-group1 = 'SC2'.
        screen-invisible = 1.
        screen-input = 0.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ELSEIF screen-group1 = 'SC1'.
        screen-invisible = 0.
        screen-input = 1.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ELSE.
    LOOP AT SCREEN.
      IF screen-group1 = 'SC2'.
        screen-invisible = 0.
        screen-input = 1.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ELSEIF screen-group1 = 'SC1'.
        screen-invisible = 1.
        screen-input = 0.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.


AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR s_file.
  CALL FUNCTION 'F4_FILENAME'
    EXPORTING
      field_name   = 'S_FILE'
      program_name = sy-cprog
    IMPORTING
      file_name    = s_file.


START-OF-SELECTION.
  IF rb_down = 'X'.
    PERFORM build_headings.
    PERFORM get_save_location.
    PERFORM download.
  ELSEIF rb_up = 'X'.
    PERFORM build_headings.
    PERFORM upload_file.
  ENDIF.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  GET_SAVE_LOCATION
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM get_save_location.
  CONCATENATE 'Template_' sy-datum sy-uzeit INTO gv_filename.

  CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_save_dialog
    EXPORTING
      window_title      = 'Select the location'
      default_extension = 'xls'
      default_file_name = gv_filename
    CHANGING
      filename          = gv_filename
      path              = gv_path
      fullpath          = gv_fullpath
      user_action       = gv_result.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  BUILD_HEADINGS
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM build_headings.
  gs_heading-heading = 'Plant'.
  APPEND gs_heading TO gt_heading.
  CLEAR gs_heading.

  gs_heading-heading = 'Model name'.
  APPEND gs_heading TO gt_heading.
  CLEAR gs_heading.

  DATA: lt_month_names LIKE TABLE OF t247.
  CALL FUNCTION 'MONTH_NAMES_GET'
    TABLES
      month_names = lt_month_names
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS      = 1.

  LOOP AT lt_month_names INTO DATA(ls_month_name).
    CONCATENATE ls_month_name-ltx '' P_year INTO DATA(lv_header).
    gs_heading-heading = lv_header.
    APPEND gs_heading TO gt_heading.
    CLEAR gs_heading.
  ENDLOOP.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  DOWNLOAD
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM download.
  LOOP AT p_model INTO DATA(s_model).
    gs_data-col1 = p_plant.
    gs_data-col2 = s_model-low.
    APPEND gs_data TO gt_data.
    CLEAR : gs_data.
  ENDLOOP.
  IF gv_fullpath IS NOT INITIAL.
    CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_DOWNLOAD'
      EXPORTING
        filename   = gv_fullpath
        filetype   = 'DAT'
      TABLES
        data_tab   = gt_data
        fieldnames = gt_heading
      EXCEPTIONS
        OTHERS     = 22.

    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      gv_template_downloaded = abap_true.

      CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>execute
        EXPORTING
          document = gv_fullpath
        EXCEPTIONS
          OTHERS   = 10.
    ENDIF.
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  UPLOAD_FILE
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM upload_file.

  CALL FUNCTION 'TEXT_CONVERT_XLS_TO_SAP'
    EXPORTING
      i_tab_raw_data       = it_raw
      i_filename           = s_file
    TABLES
      i_tab_converted_data = gt_data
    EXCEPTIONS
      conversion_failed    = 1
      OTHERS               = 2.

  IF sy-subrc = 0.
    LOOP AT gt_heading INTO DATA(lv_fieldname).
      CLEAR: lv_field,gs_fieldcat.
      lv_field = |COL{ sy-tabix }|.
      gs_fieldcat-fieldname = lv_field."lv_fieldname.
      gs_fieldcat-seltext_l = lv_fieldname.
      gs_fieldcat-col_pos = sy-tabix.
      gs_fieldcat-ctabname = 'gt_data'.
      gs_fieldcat-edit = 'X'.
      APPEND gs_fieldcat TO gt_fieldcat.
    ENDLOOP.

    gv_data = gt_data.
    DELETE gv_data  INDEX 1.
    gf_data = gv_data.


    LOOP AT gv_data ASSIGNING <fs_input>.
      READ TABLE gt_data INDEX 1 ASSIGNING <fs_month>.
      index = 1.
      DO 12 TIMES.
        ASSIGN COMPONENT sy-index + 2 OF STRUCTURE <fs_input> TO <fs_value>.
        IF sy-subrc = 0.
          CLEAR gs_prod_plan.
          gs_prod_plan-mcode   = <fs_input>-col1.
          gs_prod_plan-mname   = <fs_input>-col2.
          gs_prod_plan-zplan = <fs_value>.
          gs_prod_plan-zmonth = index.
          gs_prod_plan-zyear = p_year.
          MODIFY zzmm_m_prod_plan FROM gs_prod_plan.
        ENDIF.
        index = index + 1.
      ENDDO.
    ENDLOOP.

    CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY'
      EXPORTING
        i_callback_program       = sy-repid
        i_callback_pf_status_set = ' '
        i_callback_user_command  = 'SAVE'
        i_default                = 'X'
        i_save                   = 'S'
        it_fieldcat              = gt_fieldcat
      TABLES
        t_outtab                 = gv_data
      EXCEPTIONS
        program_error            = 1
        OTHERS                   = 2.


    MESSAGE 'File uploaded and data captured successfully.' TYPE 'S'.
  ELSE.
    MESSAGE 'Error uploading file.' TYPE 'E'.
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

FORM save USING rcomm TYPE sy-ucomm
      sel TYPE slis_selfield.

  CASE sy-ucomm.
    WHEN '&DATA_SAVE'.
      LOOP AT gv_data ASSIGNING <fs_input>.
        READ TABLE gt_data INDEX 1 ASSIGNING <fs_month>.
        READ TABLE gf_data INTO gd_data INDEX sy-tabix.
        IF <fs_input> NE gd_data.
          DO 12 TIMES.
            ASSIGN COMPONENT sy-index + 2 OF STRUCTURE <fs_input> TO <fs_value>.
            ASSIGN COMPONENT sy-index + 2 OF STRUCTURE <fs_month> TO <fs_value_1>.
            DATA: lv_date_string TYPE string,
                  lv_month_num   TYPE char2,
                  lv_day         TYPE char2,
                  lv_month_name  TYPE string.

            lv_date_string = <fs_value_1>.

            SPLIT lv_date_string AT '/' INTO lv_month_num lv_day lv_year.

            IF sy-subrc = 0.
              CLEAR gs_prod_plan.
              gs_prod_plan-mcode   = <fs_input>-col1.
              gs_prod_plan-mname   = <fs_input>-col2.
              gs_prod_plan-zplan = <fs_value>.
              gs_prod_plan-zmonth = lv_month_num.
              gs_prod_plan-zyear = lv_year.
              MODIFY zzmm_m_prod_plan FROM gs_prod_plan.
            ENDIF.
          ENDDO.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
  ENDCASE.
ENDFORM.

entry.title: Re: Not able to Copy Dataset to Planning Model and Vice V...
entry.content:
In SAP Analytics Cloud, copying data between a dataset and a planning model and vice versa is not supported directly through standard data actions because data actions work only between planning models. Datasets and planning models are different object types, and SAC does not provide out-of-the-box functionality to copy data bi-directionally between them.

Below are options to handle the scenario you described:

  • Use Data Actions to copy data between planning models only, not datasets. You can create a planning model from the dataset as a one-time step and then use data actions between planning models.
  • For copying data from a dataset to a planning model in recurring processes, you may export data from the dataset and then import it into the planning model manually or via scripts.
  • Alternatively, consider building an Analytical Application in SAC that programmatically manages data movement between dataset and models.
  • Use the SAC Data Export Service for replication scenarios between models but not directly for dataset-to-model copying.

In summary, direct bi-directional data copy between SAC datasets and planning models is not out-of-box supported; workarounds involve export/import or custom analytical apps.

For detailed guidance, see:

SAP Community question discussing dataset to model data copy limitations and workarounds

I hope this provides the desired result. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Understanding Your Workforce Spending: The "Buckets of Spend" Approach
entry.content:
Understanding Your Workforce Spending: The "Buckets of Spend" Approach 💰

When it comes to managing a business, one of the biggest and most complex expenses is your workforce. It’s not just about salaries; it's a vast ecosystem of costs that can be difficult to track. To get a handle on where your money is going, it's helpful to think in terms of "buckets of spend." This approach organizes all workforce-related expenses into major categories, giving you the clarity needed to make smarter, more strategic decisions.

The Key Buckets of Workforce Management Spend

Think of these buckets as the primary containers for every dollar you spend on your people.

1. Direct Costs

These are the most obvious expenses and form the foundation of your labor budget.

  • Salaries and Wages: The base pay for all your full-time, part-time, and contingent workers.

  • Benefits: This includes health insurance, retirement contributions, paid time off, and other employee perks.

  • Payroll Taxes: Mandatory contributions to programs like Social Security and unemployment.

  • Labor-Related Expenses: Overtime pay, shift differentials, and any other costs directly tied to employee hours.

2. Indirect Costs

These are the expenses that enable your workforce to function effectively but aren't part of their direct compensation. They are often overlooked but can add up significantly.

  • Recruitment Costs: From job board ads and agency fees to the time your team spends interviewing, every part of the hiring process has a cost.

  • Training and Development: The budget for onboarding new hires, professional development courses, and upskilling your existing team.

  • Administrative Costs: The time and resources your HR and operations teams spend on managing payroll, data, and compliance.

  • Technology Costs: Licensing fees for HR software (like Workday or BambooHR) and other tools your employees need to do their jobs.

3. Opportunity/Lost Time Costs

This bucket represents the money you lose due to inefficiency or downtime. It's often invisible on a spreadsheet but has a major impact on your bottom line.

  • Vacancies and Turnover: When a position is empty, you're not just saving on salary; you're losing the productivity that person would have contributed. High turnover means you're constantly losing institutional knowledge and spending money on recruiting.

  • Non-Productive Time (Shrinkage): This includes paid time that isn't spent on core work, such as idle time in a contact center, extended breaks, or gaps in schedule adherence.

4. Contingent and Flexible Workforce Costs

As more companies rely on freelancers, contractors, and temporary workers, this bucket is becoming increasingly important.

  • Payments to Non-Employees: This includes the fees paid to consultants, freelancers, and temporary agencies.

  • Administrative Overhead: The costs associated with managing third-party vendors and flexible work agreements.

A Deeper Look: Workforce Management IT & Technology Spend

Technology is no longer just an administrative tool; it's a core component of workforce management. This category deserves its own focus because it impacts every other bucket.

  • Hardware: Laptops, phones, and other devices provided to employees.

  • Software: Licensing for HRIS, payroll systems, and specialized workforce management platforms.

  • Infrastructure and Security: The costs to ensure your remote teams have secure access and the necessary support.

  • Ongoing Support: The budget for IT help, upgrades, and logistical support for your workforce's technology needs.

By breaking down your IT spend, you can see if you're over-investing in one area and under-investing in another, ensuring your tech stack truly supports your business goals.

Best Practices for Managing Your Spend

Simply identifying these buckets isn't enough. You need to actively manage them.

  1. Use Data to Inform Decisions: Don't rely on static budgets. Continuously audit your spending and adjust based on actual workforce needs and performance.

  2. Monitor for Inefficiencies: Are your recruitment times too long? Is there excessive administrative work? Map your spend to both direct and indirect costs to spot and fix these hidden drains.

  3. Regularly Review Your Cost Allocation: As your business evolves and your workforce mix changes (e.g., more remote workers, more contractors), your cost allocation should change, too.

By segmenting your workforce expenses into these buckets, you gain powerful visibility into where your labor costs are accruing. This allows you to make more informed decisions about where to optimize, invest, or reduce spend to build a more efficient and profitable organization.

Bruce Fischbach - Sr. Manager - Solution Value Advisory Fieldglass

Jennifer Lutters - Sr. Product Advocate SAP Fieldglass

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to create a sales order referencing an...
entry.content:
It is not possible to change the sales org field in the sales order. As you know it is greyed out.

The sales org cannot be different between the current and the referenced documents. I have copied the long text of the resulting error message below:

Sales organizations deviate from each other. & and/or & (reference)

Message no. V2007

Diagnosis

The sales organization of the reference document is not the same as the sales organization of the target document.

Procedure

If you want to add to an existing document by referring to another document, select a reference document with the same sales organization as the target document.
If you want to create a new document by referring to a document, make certain that the sales organization and the document number are correct.

---------

The behavior outlined in the following On-premise KBA is also accurate for S/4HANA Public Cloud:

 > 1601103    Contracts cannot be used across sales organisations

entry.title: Re: Confifg：Determine Requirement Type by Item category C...
entry.content:
Hello  @ISoma 

Thanks for the screenshot.

SAP will not alter the mapping in Determine Requirement Type by Item Category SSCUI 105120 for TAN within a single tenant. Since this content is delivered and locked in Public Cloud, neither an incident nor an expert configuration will unlock it.

What you can currently do is supported.

Drive the requirement type from master data

    • Set Strategy Group / MRP Type in the product master.
    • Standard determination then picks the requirement type/class from the material’s planning strategy (this overrides the generic TAN fallback).

Use an alternative item category were allowed

    • If your scope allows, establish a Y* item category and assign it through item-category determination to the appropriate scenarios...
    • You still cannot edit 105120, but you can pair the Y-category with materials or schedule lines that produce the requirement type you need.

Model the business need via the schedule line and  planning strategy

    • Select MTS versus MTO behaviour through material planning settings so the system determines the correct requirements logic without tenant-specific changes.

Product change request (longer term)

    • If you need a different standard mapping for TAN, submit it via SAP Continuous Influence, as SAP does not supply one-off tenant mapping adjustments.

If you specify the exact behaviour you want, such as MTO for product X, no MRP reduction, or specific ATP logic, I’ll propose a concrete combination of Strategy Group/MRP Type and  item/schedule line that achieves it without modifying 105120.

SAP Document References

  • SAP Help Portal - Central Business Configuration:
  • SAP Community - Clean Core Strategy:
  • SAP Help Portal - Item Category Determination:

entry.title: Re: SAC save data analyzer
entry.content:
@egil63 

Data Analyzer is a perfect option for adhoc data Analysis for an end user. 

  • If you are assigned to the creator or admin role, you can save an insight in the public or your private files.

  • If you are assigned to a viewer role, you can save an insight in your private files only. To do this an administrator can grant the private insight privilege to users with no create rights on the public or private files by creating a custom role and assigning the private insight privilege. With the private insight privilege, these users can also share and delete their insights however they can't edit or rename the insight in the file repository. For more information on creating custom roles, please see Create Roles.

  • You can save an insight to any workspace that you have access to

For permissions Refer to below.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/93fec5646f144e109745ce74fd492c3f.html#object-type-permissions

Hope this helps

Nikhil

entry.title: How to use key-user in-app Custom Logic extensibility to change eDocument currency in SAP Cloud ERP
entry.content:
Introduction

Some countries (like Colombia) might required to have reports sent to fiscal authority on their local currency even if the transaction was executed in a different currency and is registered on the system in a foreign currency. On  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition this requirement might be delivered in some localizations via extensibility as a localization as a Self-service to be implemented during implementation project.

Below example, shows how a sale in USD would be reported without the extensibility (left) and with extensibility solution (right):

Solution through Extensibility 

Based on a demand for Colombia invoice eDocument, we have developed the KBA 3648968.

On the KBA, we instruct how to find extension points (BAdIs) to change information in eDocument generated via eDocument Cockpit or Manage Electronic Documents apps. We also highlight that for each localization, it should be consulted the SAP Help Portal documentation for that localization to check which extension points are available and which should be used.

We also provide a proof-of-concept sample code that shows how the change for a XML file created for an eDocument for Colombia can be changed. Note that each localization and eDocument likely will have different extension points and limitation as well as each implementation might have its own requirements that will result on complete different code.

So each implementation should develop its own code and the KBA code is only an example and do not cover all scenarios nor is a final solution to be implemented.

Important Assets

The following documentation might be helpful to obtain more detailed information:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition:

    • SAP KBA 2805847 - eDocument Colombia Troubleshooting Guide (Topic B103)
    • SAP KBA 3648968 - Currency issues and Extensibility in Colombia eDocuments - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
    • SAP KBA 2974488 - Calculation errors in CUFE
    • SAP Help Portal:  Colombia App Extensibility
    • SAP Help Portal: Country/Region-Specific Functions
    • SAP Help Portal: Creating Implementations

This content was brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Customer Care Team

entry.title: Re: UIGEF001 maps in S4HANA 2023
entry.content:
Hi Elang234, 

Here's the answer in detail why we cannot support UIGEF001 in future release.

The SAP Geo Framework applications in component UIGEF001 are supported until S/4HANA 2021, with conditions.

New applications were created in S/4HANA 2021 in the default UI component UIS4HOP1 and are the preferred applications, with UIGEF001 applications only being used by existing customers during cutover from UIGEF001 to UIS4HOP1. Some customers may need time to migrate customer extensions to the new apps while running on an upgraded S/4HANA release. All these applications are based on the 3.x Esri JavaScript API.

In S/4HANA 2022 FPS1  SAP introduced new applications based on the Esri 4.x JavaScript API and will be the future Esri API platform for the Geo Framework. It is strongly suggested that customers move to these applications by S/4HANA 2023. Both 3.x and 4.x applications may be run in parallel during cutover. In a future release of S/4HANA the applications based on the 3.x API will be deprecated as Esri support for this API is ended. Here is the latest GEF Administration guide to follow.

Installation:

Follow the appropriate Master Guide for your implementation

  • 2383937 - SAP Geographical Enablement Framework - Installation & Upgrade Information Master Note (UIGEF001)
  • 3149622 - SAP Geographical Enablement Framework - Installation & Upgrade Information Master Note (UIS4HOP1)

It is strongly suggested that all UI support packages be implemented and subsequent notes applied to ensure correct functionality.

Ensure the applicable note for your UI component are implemented to avoid incorrect time entries when editing geometry.

  • 3409341 - [GEFUI] : Utilities UTC End Date Assignment Function Issue
  • 3419897 - [S4GEF] GEF_DATE_TO is populating with incorrect UTC format

Review note 2878649 - HANA Update to 1909 Fix for Data Type Date Fields Update. This will ensure your initial configuration is correct after an SAP BASIS level change.

Fully implement and test the base Geo Framework sample implementation before implementing EAM content.

  • Activate Business Function FND_GEF.
  • Ensure switch dependent BC sets are correctly activated. It may be some items are not fully activated due to system/client settings preventing the automated activation. Should this happen you will need to manually activate the dependent BC set for the switch.

After successfully testing the default configuration activate the EAM Business function.

  • Activate Business Function LOG_EAM_GEF.
  • Ensure switch dependent BC sets are correctly activated and manually activate if required.

Complete configuration for Database Connection as per online documentation. You should now have a basic working system to test.

Implementation:

Best practice suggests tables for each Business Object. This ensures the latest table deign and optimizations are in place. Implementation is performed using the following steps.

  • Using transaction GEF_CRT_TAB create tables for each of the EAM business objects. It is suggested to use a short prefix such as “Notif” for Notifications. A suffix is not required and the SRID can be included if desired.
  • Update the configuration for each Business Object to point to the relevant table/view prefix, remember to include the “.” At the end. For example “Notif_3857.”
  • Should you wish to also use System level tables for non-EAM objects it is suggested to create new tables with the most current design using the same transaction, for example “SysGeom_3857.” . Update configuration for system configuration.

Because SAP does not know how a customer will translate their assets to map objects the delivered EAM configuration is an example of how EAM objects can be geo enabled. This configuration should be treated as an example and used as a guide for own implementations.

It is suggested that the most complex Geo Object be configured first and then used as a copy template for other Geo Objects. It is much easier to delete unwanted entries from the copy than manually add content, and then change the template configuration to suit each individual object.

Thanks,
Nick.

entry.title: Re: Issue in Fiori App Mass Maintenance of Bills of Mater...
entry.content:
Hi @nitin_desai_c79 

Thank you for your question.

The error you are experiencing means that the maximum threshold for simulation is being read as 0, even though you have maintained the control parameter in customizing.

To resolve the error, here is what you should check:

  1. Check your Business Role Authorization
    • Ensure the user has the correct Business Catalog assigned. For example, SAP_BOM_MASS_MAINT_PC or equivalent. Please note, if authorizations are incomplete, the system may not pick up the maintained threshold.
  2. Control Parameters for BoM (SSCUI / App)
    • In SSCUI 102543, the control parameters for Bill of Material, check that the parameter Maximum No. of BOMs for Mass Changes is indeed set to 1000.
    • Also confirm that this configuration is assigned to the correct plant/application area.
  3. Re-publish Settings
    • After updating the SSCUI, ensure you publish and re-test the app. Sometimes cached parameters are not picked up until a new session.

Please note that in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the Simulation step uses a stricter threshold check than execution. If the threshold is not picked up, the system defaults to 0.

Mass Maintenance of Bills of Material Items

I hope this provides the desired result. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris
